original:
Methanol can be synthesized from carbon dioxide (CO2) through catalytic hydrogenation, a process that involves the reaction of CO2 with hydrogen (H2). The hydrogen used in this process can be generated via water electrolysis. One notable example of this method is employed by Carbon Recycling International in Iceland.
